Item(by='seepel', descendants=None, kids=[25983079, 25984016], score=None, time=1612129116, title=None, item_type='comment', url=None, parent=25979293, text='&gt; What thing that violates a type check would be &quot;perfectly fine to do&quot;?<p>Here is an example limitation of typescript&#x27;s type system that I routinely run into while developing real code [1].<p>I look at it like this. If you consider all possible programs, some are invalid, some are valid, and some are valid and useful. A type system&#x27;s job is to reject as many invalid programs as possible while accepting as many valid programs as possible and trying to optimize for useful valid programs. Due to the halting problem this is impossible to do perfectly, so any given type system will likely accept some invalid programs and reject some useful valid programs. If the type system happens to reject your useful valid program, you&#x27;ll likely have a bad day :)<p>[1] <a href="https:&#x2F;&#x2F;www.typescriptlang.org&#x2F;play?#code&#x2F;PTAEHUFNQCwQwG7TgO1HADhgNgSwMZwAuuA9mkfEaACaRzYDOoA7rpaJOzJAE6gBlIgFc6KIs1L8AYnHzDsRAJ4A6AFC5xfAGZzoQ0ZHGgA3mtCcAtnFzYAXKEZFemgObnQrjHAdOXKdwBfNQ0tXl18aFl5RSVTD0hrW19nNw9GBjheJRT---" rel="nofollow">https:&#x2F;&#x2F;www.typescriptlang.org&#x2F;play?#code&#x2F;PTAEHUFNQCwQwG7TgO...</a>')
